definition: predominantly photosynthetic prokaryotic organisms containing a blue pigment in addition to chlorophyll; occur singly or in colonies in diverse habitats; important as phytoplankton
opposite_reasoning: Eukaryote represents the most fundamental and scientifically valid taxonomic opposition to Cyanobacteria. The prokaryote/eukaryote division is the primary cellular dichotomy in biology. While this opposition has limited direct AI safety implications, it provides the strongest semantic contrast for Fisher-LDA separation in biological concept space. This is a clear case where the concept is highly specific to biology and lacks relevance to deception/alignment monitoring.
